commit_message:
Add authorize method to Enforcer

To facilitate projects wishing to ensure that all policies are
registered before use an authorize method has been added which errors
when checking an unregistered policy. If the policy has been registered
then the enforce method is called in the normal manner.

Change-Id: I0ce578611bbdc16c10e140eff34c955e16b437dc
Implements: bp policy-in-code

added_lines: def test_authorize_opt_registered(self): self.enforcer.register_rule(policy.PolicyOpt(name='test', rule='role:test')) self.assertTrue(self.enforcer.authorize('test', {}, {'roles': ['test']})) def test_authorize_opt_not_registered(self): self.assertRaises(policy.PolicyNotRegistered, self.enforcer.authorize, 'test', {}, {'roles': ['test']})

commit_message:
Add __str__ to PolicyOpt

In case it is ever useful to print or log a PolicyOpt object add a
useful string representation.

commit_message:
Add helper methods for generating policy info

This adds two helper methods that consuming projects can use to get
information that helps deployers.

The generate_policy method takes a configured policy.Enforcer and
outputs a yaml formatted policy file for that configuration. This can be
used for audit purposes or to use with a tool like oslopolicy-checker.

The generate_matches method takes a configured policy.Enforcer and
returns a list of policy.PolicyOpt objects for policies defined in a
config file which match registered defaults. This helps deployers winnow
down their configured policies to just those that are actual overrides.

Change-Id: Ic813ee690636ab41448aa22d2121a64cf49936c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/74/314774/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_policy import policy def _format_policy_opt_yaml(opt, include_help=True): :param include_help: If True add a comment from the opt description text = ('"%(name)s": "%(rule)s"\n' % {'name': opt.name, if include_help: text = ('%(help)s\n%(text)s' % {'help': _format_help_text(opt.description), 'text': text})def _sort_and_format_by_section(policies, include_help=True): section_text_list.append( _format_policy_opt_yaml(policy_opt, include_help=include_help))def generate_policy(enforcer, output_file=None): """Generate a policy file showing what will be used. This takes all registered policies and merges them with what's defined in a policy file and outputs the result. That result is the effective policy that will be honored by policy checks. :param enforcer: a policy.Enforcer object. This should match what is used for policy checks in the service. :param output_file: The path of a file to output to. stdout used if None. """ # Ensure that files have been parsed enforcer.load_rules() output_file = (open(output_file, 'w') if output_file else sys.stdout) policies = {'rules': [policy.PolicyOpt(name, str(parsed_rule)) for name, parsed_rule in enforcer.rules.items()]} for section in _sort_and_format_by_section(policies, include_help=False): output_file.write(section) def generate_matches(enforcer): """Generate a list of configured policies which match defaults. This checks all policies loaded from policy files and checks to see if they match registered policies. If so then it is redundant to have them defined in a policy file and operators should consider removing them. :param enforcer: a policy.Enforcer object. This should match what is used for policy checks in the service. :returns: A list of PolicyOpt objects """ # Ensure that files have been parsed enforcer.load_rules() matches = [] for name, file_opt in enforcer.file_rules.items(): reg_rule = enforcer.registered_rules.get(name, None) if reg_rule: if str(file_opt.parsed_rule) == str(reg_rule.parsed_rule): matches.append(reg_rule) return matches

commit_message:
Enable IPAM drivers to allocate from more than one subnet

Calling in to the IPAM driver independently for each subnet on a
network can be costly, especially if the IPAM system is external.
This change opens the possibility of optimizing the operation of
allocating one IP address from a list of candidate subnets by allowing
drivers to subclass the default implementation.

Change-Id: I07b32752e1e2e84641dd6504a93cfef95ae368c5
Partially-Implements: blueprint bp/routed-networks

commit_message:
Fix for statistic_aggregation

This patch set fixes aggregate parameter for statistic_aggregation
function so we may use it with any aggregate function.

Change-Id: If586d656aadd3d098a1610a97a2f315e70351de5
Closes-Bug: #1583610

commit_message:
pin Tempest to 12.0.0, current stable for Liberty

Instead of checkouting master or using zuul-cloner, let's pin 12.0.0
so it makes our CI more stable and we'll stop breaking everytime a
new patch in master is breaking us.

Change-Id: I1f34d1b422a9e6e1aaffe0c44252d5eacc84d347
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/40/318640/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Tempest 12.0.0 is the last stable version that supports Liberty # http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v12.0.0.html git clone -b 12.0.0 git://git.openstack.org/openstack/tempest /tmp/openstack/tempest
deleted_lines: # TODO(pabelanger): Move this into tools/install_tempest.sh and add logic so we # can clone tempest outside of the gate. Also, tempest should be sandboxed into # the local directory but works needs to be added into puppet to properly find # the path. if [ -e /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ] ; then /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner --workspace /tmp --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org openstack/tempest else # remove existed checkout before clone $SUDO rm -rf /tmp/openstack/tempest # We're outside the gate, just do a regular git clone git clone git://git.openstack.org/openstack/tempest /tmp/openstack/tempest fi

commit_message:
Add support for custom JSON serializer

Allow to specify custom JSON serializer / deserializer functions to be
used by DB API dialects such as psycopg2 or pymysql for native JSON
types in DBs.

Change-Id: Iad98ca1e10169239f1f6b94b1b598f653b14f0c4

commit_message:
fix network configuration

When deploying with `network_isolation: true`, we are failing to pass
in the network settings from our configuration into the tripleo
deployment process, leading ultimately to deployment failures when
attempting to use non-default values.

additionally, setting `network_isolation: true` required adding a
number of explicit arguments to `extra_args`, so it was not possible
to control the use of network isolation simply by toggling the value
of `network_isolation`.

This commits allows the deployment to succeed with `network_isolation`
either disabled or enabled, and allows the use of non-default values
for the network configuration.

Change-Id: I68f5a87e390aa2ea8d8c5631eba17dc5dd44270e
Closes-bug: #1581659

commit_message:
Lowercase Compute in an example header

Headers are case insensitive, so case doesn't actually matter. However,
the normal form for compute in the keystone catalog is all lower case -
so seeing it here as leading-caps brings a cognitive dissonance that
isn't valuable.

Change-Id: Ief3e5263b421b1b59165b40a073c9a2fbd321dea

commit_message:
Add 'offset' parameter to URL on tests detail page

This adds an 'offset' parameter to the URL on the tests detail page,
so that state is correctly saved in shared URLs.

Change-Id: I05fe38d45e4c88115514b3f0aca77705404bc991
Partial-Bug: 1572763

subject: Apply query to highlight query
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 15:09:34.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/unit/v1/test_search.py', 'searchlight/api/v1/search.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/searchlight/commit/7402a545e5339a097095ce2b460c6bd9c1be9c72', 'message': 'Apply query to highlight query

If not specified, highlighting defaults to attempting to reapply the
entire query to documents successfully matched. Since we apply our RBAC
terms in a filtered_query, the highlighter attempts to include them.

Elasticsearch 2.1 highlights this (pun intended) because highlighting
parent/child queries doesn't work; in ES 1.x it failed silently.
Although the underlying bug for 2.x will likely be fixed (see
https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/14999), the behavior is
wrong.

This patch applies the "query" as "highlight_query" to all highlighted
fields, unless a "highlight_query" is already provided.

Change-Id: I665d629456ee4fa20c194e65b38b198ac0861f1d
Closes-Bug: #1570213
(cherry picked from commit 204d7b4232031517e1da1e3b02f4fc1809813002)
'}]
commit_message:
Apply query to highlight query

If not specified, highlighting defaults to attempting to reapply the
entire query to documents successfully matched. Since we apply our RBAC
terms in a filtered_query, the highlighter attempts to include them.

Elasticsearch 2.1 highlights this (pun intended) because highlighting
parent/child queries doesn't work; in ES 1.x it failed silently.
Although the underlying bug for 2.x will likely be fixed (see
https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/14999), the behavior is
wrong.

This patch applies the "query" as "highlight_query" to all highlighted
fields, unless a "highlight_query" is already provided.

Change-Id: I665d629456ee4fa20c194e65b38b198ac0861f1d
Closes-Bug: #1570213
(cherry picked from commit 204d7b4232031517e1da1e3b02f4fc1809813002)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/29/318729/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _set_highlight_queries(self, highlight, query): """If no 'highlight_query' is given, use the input query to avoid highlighting all the filter terms we add for RBAC. """ highlight_fields = highlight.get('fields', {}) for field_name, highlight_params in six.iteritems(highlight_fields): if 'highlight_query' not in highlight_params: highlight_params['highlight_query'] = query # require_field_match defaults to True in es-2, and prevents # highlighting for a field-less query_string ("query": "web") # because the _all field doesn't count as matching any given field if 'require_field_match' not in highlight_params: highlight_params['require_field_match'] = False self._set_highlight_queries(highlight, query)

commit_message:
Add heat dataplane context

This context will be used to deploy heat stack by given template.

Change-Id: I31f878730103fdfe1956aa96f0399bb22001d767
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/31/297631/35 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015: Mirantis Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from rally.common.i18n import _ from rally.common import logging from rally.common import utils as rutils from rally import consts from rally.plugins.openstack.cleanup import manager as resource_manager from rally.plugins.openstack.scenarios.heat import utils as heat_utils from rally.task import context LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @context.configure(name="heat_workload", order=435) class HeatWorkload(context.Context): """Context class for create stack by given template.""" CONFIG_SCHEMA = { "type": "object", "$schema": consts.JSON_SCHEMA, "properties": { "stacks_per_tenant": { "type": "integer", "minimum": 1 }, "template": { "type": "string", }, "files": { "type": "object", }, "parameters": { "type": "object", }, "context_parameters": { "type": "object", }, }, "additionalProperties": False } DEFAULT_CONFIG = { "stacks_per_tenant": 1, } def _get_context_parameter(self, user, tenant_id, value): keys = value.split(".") value = {"user": user, "tenant": self.context["tenants"][tenant_id]} while keys: key = keys.pop(0) try: key = int(key) except ValueError: pass value = value[key] return value @logging.log_task_wrapper(LOG.info, _("Enter context: `Stacks`")) def setup(self): template = open(self.config["template"]).read() files = {} for key, filename in self.config.get("files", {}).items(): files[key] = open(filename).read() for user, tenant_id in rutils.iterate_per_tenants( self.context["users"]): parameters = self.config.get("parameters", {}) for name, value in self.config.get("context_parameters").items(): parameters[name] = self._get_context_parameter(user, tenant_id, value) heat_scenario = heat_utils.HeatScenario( {"user": user, "task": self.context["task"]}) self.context["tenants"][tenant_id]["stack_workloads"] = [] for i in range(self.config["stacks_per_tenant"]): stack = heat_scenario._create_stack(template, files=files, parameters=parameters) tenant_data = self.context["tenants"][tenant_id] tenant_data["stack_workloads"].append([stack.id, template, files, parameters]) @logging.log_task_wrapper(LOG.info, _("Exit context: `Stacks`")) def cleanup(self): resource_manager.cleanup(names=["heat.stacks"], users=self.context.get("users", []))

commit_message:
Updated the link as per comments

This fixes the broken link seen in developer docs.
It was missing the file extension, due to which it was
unable to figure out the correct file. Added .html to
the documentation so that correct link is used.

Change-Id: I5ec45bef570198c231e4dd7a2e6ef2efa4b92550
Closes-Bug: 1583016

commit_message:
Add unit test for class octavia::db::sync

Change-Id: I8ce0c998dfd797924dbaa28e0dc0154156fb9290
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-octavia refs/changes/18/318718/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'octavia::db::sync' do shared_examples_for 'octavia-dbsync' do it 'runs octavia-db-sync' do is_expected.to contain_exec('octavia-db-sync').with( :command => 'octavia-manage db_sync', :path => '/usr/bin/', :user => 'octavia', :refreshonly => 'true', :subscribe => ['Package[octavia]', 'Octavia_config[database/connection]'], ) end describe "overriding extra_params" do let :params do { :extra_params => '--config-file /etc/octavia/octavia.conf', } end it { is_expected.to contain_exec('octavia-db-sync').with( :command => 'octavia-manage db_sync --config-file /etc/octavia/octavia.conf', :path => '/usr/bin/', :user => 'octavia', :refreshonly => 'true', :subscribe => ['Package[octavia]', 'Octavia_config[database/connection]'], ) } end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge(OSDefaults.get_facts({ :processorcount => 8, :concat_basedir => '/var/lib/puppet/concat' })) end it_configures 'octavia-dbsync' end end end

commit_message:
Use the same key for memcache and env['swift.infocache']

When we were caching directly to the WSGI environment, it made sense to
have different keys for the different caches. Now that we have a
separate data structure for the per-request cache, however, we ought to
be consistent.

Change-Id: I199cba6e5fc9ab4205bba369e6a2f34fc5ce22d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/66/310566/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swift.proxy.controllers.base import get_account_memcache_key, \ cache_key = get_object_env_key('a', 'c2', 'o2') env.setdefault('swift.infocache', {})[cache_key] = \ cache_key = get_account_memcache_key('a') env.setdefault('swift.infocache', {})[cache_key] = \
deleted_lines: from swift.proxy.controllers.base import _get_cache_key, \ env_key = get_object_env_key('a', 'c2', 'o2') env.setdefault('swift.infocache', {})[env_key] = \ cache_key, env_key = _get_cache_key('a', None) env.setdefault('swift.infocache', {})[env_key] = \

subject: Associate subnets to segments through subnet API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-04 22:31:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/eb24a23f17adb90f5daa600ca11bcabf8cba607b', 'message': '[WIP] Associate subnets to segments

This is just a start.  There is much to do.
TODO:

- IPAM needs to record the segment_id with the subnet.
- UTs for creating with segment_id and reading segment_id
- IP allocation from a subnet associated to a segment should be
  deferred until host binding so that the segment is known and

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary created_at from ORM Message

ORM Message Class inherits from CinderBase, which in turn inherits from
Oslo's TimestampMixin, which means that created_at is already defined
and therefore there is no need to redefine it again.

This patch removes unnecessary "created_at" field from the ORM model.

Change-Id: I58d9d953add77a64836863026b28a94e5c2e9dd1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/10/314210/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
InvalidHostForRebuildNotEnoughVIOS mock needs additional param

The exception being raised as a side effect in a mock now needs
to take a parameter. We'll get an error if the replacement
value is not given.

Change-Id: I6b63a625331772e39a6921cda6eb487193f12dce
Closes-Bug: #1583627

commit_message:
Cleanup orphaned DHCP resources on enable

The current DHCP agent's implementation doesn't perform a complete
check for an existing device when setting up DHCP on a network.
In particular, if a subset of a network's DHCP resources are deleted
out-of-band (ex: namespace), the current check will pass resulting in
a new set of network DHCP resources being created, and the lingering
ones forgotten + orphaned.

Moreover, the existing interface drivers unplug() methods are not
idempotent and thus cannot be used to clean-up linering resources
for a said device; they only succeed when all DHCP resources exist.

This patch addresses the issue by introducing inherrited base logic
allowing lingering resources to be detected and cleaned up with
idempotence in mind. While the same result could be obtained by
adding logic to each driver, this approach reduces the code footprint
as well as duplication.

NB: I do realize this patch is a bit beefy. I'm more than happy to
refector into smaller patches assuming we can get some agreement
that this approach is acceptable.

Change-Id: Ib162510a8d781a027635000c471f42819201a16e
Closes-Bug: #1567049

InvalidHostForRebuildNotEnoughVIOS mock needs additional param

The exception being raised as a side effect in a mock now needs
to take a parameter. We'll get an error if the replacement
value is not given.

Change-Id: I6b63a625331772e39a6921cda6eb487193f12dce
Closes-Bug: #1583627

commit_message:
Speed up processing of deploy message

Load only progress column in nodes instead of upload all node
columns in recalculate_deployment_task_progress in TaskHelper

Related-Bug: #1570509

Change-Id: Id3a7a0f8e2ae62d4130d36ae9d4c13b0e4419acf
(cherry picked from commit a1cafe9837b3d04ed4b2510eaf679b31f47c3fd0)

commit_message:
Bump rate for osic to 0.5

I've noticed when osic is not under load (empty check / gate pipeline)
we don't leak any FIPs. But once we start putting pressure on osic, we
start leaking FIPs fast.  We still don't know why but as a test, lets
throttle our API calls to see what happens.

Change-Id: I2c0e79f954de0e4ad2a011b168e670d8c0691e12
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
oidc: add OidcToken class to authenticate reusing an access token

Some services or users may have obtained an access token, so it would be
possible to authenticate using this token directly (for example a
service where the user has already logged in). This new class makes
possible to use an access token to authenticate directly with Keystone,
exchanging it for a Keystone token.

Implements: blueprint openid-connect
Change-Id: I4c14a074178c4af23aaee56d0eb26599b292d866
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/68/317968/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: v3oidctoken = keystoneclient.contrib.auth.v3.oidc:OidcToken

commit_message:
Basic Extension and CRUD for Segments

This patch enables CRUD on Segments by defining a new entity called
'Segment' with an extension definition and some DB code to read the
existing segments DB.  A basic framework for create, update, and
delete are provided.

For now, this is just the basic boiler-plate but I've got to start
somewhere.  It is implemented as a service plugin that is disabled by
default because it has not been fully tested with any plugin.
Follow-on patches will implement support for this new extension in
ML2 and OVN at least.

Change-Id: Ifc370fdd38f9a5b296334635fa85bd93d270b910
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
[kafka] Add several bootstrap servers support

At that moment kafka driver can use only url with one "host:port"
for the bootstrap server defining, but kafka client supports
set of host:port adresses: "host1:port1,host2:port2", ... .
This patch implement this functional in kafka driver for the better HA.

List self.hostaddrs stores strings "host:port" of Connection.
It collects from self.url.hosts

Change-Id: I5eece66ca6bd069a0df8c8629b4ac815f69a7c7d
Closes-Bug: #1572017

commit_message:
Ignore SendEnv LC_* from ssh clients of master

If ssh client will send his Languange to server. They will be
accepted and in some cases it can cause breaking of python code.
To avoid unintended language settings let's ignore them.

Change-Id: Iabee9ef57244ea37972af16b1315118c349c30ac
Closes-bug: #1573638
(cherry picked from commit 7b904d2f3b4c035cdcf890ea45ab6eb65764a141)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/24/318524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'accept_env' => '# LANG LC_*',

commit_message:
Add support for Storage hooks

This adds support for Juju's storage hooks by merging the config
provided osd-devices with Juju storage provided osd-devices, in the
same way that the existing Ceph charm handles them.

In addition to providing support for ceph-osds via Juju storage,
we provide support for multiple journal devices through Juju storage
as well.

We have to add a shim hook to ensure that Ceph is installed prior
to storage hook invocation because storage attached at deploy time
will execute hooks before the install hook

Change-Id: Idad46e8f4cc32e09fbd64d29cd93745662e9f542
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/36/302736/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ceph_hooks.py

subject: Plugin links handlers now returning 409 on existing url
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-28 16:49:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/500c68aea947b29c2fae8eeef2af0a3b2721153e', 'message': 'Plugin links handlers now returning 409 on existing url

Previous behaviour allowed to create multiple links with the same url
what was occurring during plugin tasks re-run.

Now 409 error is returned when plugin- or cluster-level link creating
or updating with the non-unique URL value.
Plugin developers should handle such exception by themselves
in plugin tasks.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1538209

Change-Id: I1de1e9f3957cbe11e91cd8cd4806ac1cd714d630
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-29 10:06:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/2ad557ee497bcec64913ae6da23f1daaff89d2a8', 'message': 'Plugin links handlers now returning 409 on existing url

Previous behaviour allowed to create multiple links with the same url
what was occurring during plugin tasks re-run.

Now 409 error is returned when plugin- or cluster-level link creating
or updating with the non-unique URL value.
Plugin developers should handle such exception by themselves
in plugin tasks.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Plugin links handlers now returning 409 on existing url

Previous behaviour allowed to create multiple links with the same url
what was occurring during plugin tasks re-run.

Now 409 error is returned when plugin- or cluster-level link creating
or updating with the non-unique URL value.
Plugin developers should handle such exception by themselves
in plugin tasks.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1538209

Change-Id: I1de1e9f3957cbe11e91cd8cd4806ac1cd714d630

commit_message:
Apply query to highlight query

If not specified, highlighting defaults to attempting to reapply the
entire query to documents successfully matched. Since we apply our RBAC
terms in a filtered_query, the highlighter attempts to include them.

Elasticsearch 2.1 highlights this (pun intended) because highlighting
parent/child queries doesn't work; in ES 1.x it failed silently.
Although the underlying bug for 2.x will likely be fixed (see
https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/14999), the behavior is
wrong.

This patch applies the "query" as "highlight_query" to all highlighted
fields, unless a "highlight_query" is already provided.

Change-Id: I665d629456ee4fa20c194e65b38b198ac0861f1d
Closes-Bug: #1570213
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/34/311834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _set_highlight_queries(self, highlight, query): """If no 'highlight_query' is given, use the input query to avoid highlighting all the filter terms we add for RBAC. """ highlight_fields = highlight.get('fields', {}) for field_name, highlight_params in six.iteritems(highlight_fields): if 'highlight_query' not in highlight_params: highlight_params['highlight_query'] = query self._set_highlight_queries(highlight, query)

commit_message:
Remove unused parameters in OidcPassword methods

Some methods from OidcPassword accepted a parameter to indicate the URL
where a request was to be made:

- _get_keystone_token accepted federated_token_url, the URL for
  federated authentication.
- _get_access_token accepted access_token_endpoint, the URL used to get
  an oidc access token.

However, they were using the object attribute self.access_token_endpoint
and the property self.federated_token_url, therefore they were
completely ignored. This changes remoes them.

Change-Id: I18a5632cf3967228214aa99ec6d07d9bfcab09d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/66/317966/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: response = self._get_access_token(session, client_auth, payload) response = self._get_keystone_token(session, headers) def _get_access_token(self, session, client_auth, payload): def _get_keystone_token(self, session, headers):
deleted_lines: response = self._get_access_token(session, client_auth, payload, self.access_token_endpoint) response = self._get_keystone_token(session, headers, self.federated_token_url) def _get_access_token(self, session, client_auth, payload, access_token_endpoint): :param access_token_endpoint: URL to use to get an access token, for example: https://localhost/oidc/token :type access_token_endpoint: string def _get_keystone_token(self, session, headers, federated_token_url): :param federated_auth_url: Protected URL for federated authentication, for example: https://localhost:5000/v3/\ OS-FEDERATION/identity_providers/bluepages/\ protocols/oidc/auth :type federated_auth_url: string

commit_message:
oidc: create an OidcBase class with common methods

OidcPassword defined some methods that can be reused for other OpenID
Connect grant types and authentication flows (like reusing an existing
access token), so lets split the common code into a base class.

This patch is required to support the incoming OidcToken auth plugin.

Partially-Implements: blueprint openid-connect
Change-Id: Ia388023ce86436ebfe583314d308f8ea08d63ca0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/67/317967/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class OidcBase(federated.FederatedBaseAuth): @positional(4) def __init__(self, auth_url, identity_provider, protocol, **kwargs): """The OpenID Connect plugin. It expects the following: :param auth_url: URL of the Identity Service :type auth_url: string :param identity_provider: Name of the Identity Provider the client will authenticate against :type identity_provider: string :param protocol: Protocol name as configured in keystone :type protocol: string """ super(OidcBase, self).__init__(auth_url, identity_provider, protocol, **kwargs) def _get_keystone_token(self, session, access_token): """Exchange an access token for a keystone token. By Sending the access token in an `Authorization: Bearer` header, to an OpenID Connect protected endpoint (Federated Token URL). The OpenID Connect server will use the access token to look up information about the authenticated user (this technique is called instrospection). The output of the instrospection will be an OpenID Connect Claim, that will be used against the mapping engine. Should the mapping engine succeed, a Keystone token will be presented to the user. :param session: a session object to send out HTTP requests. :type session: keystoneclient.session.Session :param access_token: The access token to be exchanged. :type access_token: string """ # use access token against protected URL headers = {'Authorization': 'Bearer ' + access_token} response = session.post(self.federated_token_url, headers=headers, authenticated=False) # grab the unscoped token token = response.headers['X-Subject-Token'] token_json = response.json()['token'] return token, token_json class OidcPassword(OidcBase): """Implement authentication plugin for OpenID Connect protocol. This class implements the OIDC 'password' grant_type. OIDC or OpenID Connect is a protocol for federated authentication. The OpenID Connect specification can be found at:: ``http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html`` """ token, token_json = self._get_keystone_token(session, access_token)
deleted_lines: class OidcPassword(federated.FederatedBaseAuth): # use access token against protected URL headers = {'Authorization': 'Bearer ' + access_token} response = self._get_keystone_token(session, headers) # grab the unscoped token token = response.headers['X-Subject-Token'] token_json = response.json()['token'] def _get_keystone_token(self, session, headers): """Exchange an acess token for a keystone token. By Sending the access token in an `Authorization: Bearer` header, to an OpenID Connect protected endpoint (Federated Token URL). The OpenID Connect server will use the access token to look up information about the authenticated user (this technique is called instrospection). The output of the instrospection will be an OpenID Connect Claim, that will be used against the mapping engine. Should the mapping engine succeed, a Keystone token will be presented to the user. :param session: a session object to send out HTTP requests. :type session: keystoneclient.session.Session :param headers: an Authorization header containing the access token. :type headers_: dict """ auth_response = session.post(self.federated_token_url, headers=headers, authenticated=False) return auth_response

commit_message:
Fix Network Templates Verification for environments with DPDK nodes

Don't check private VLAN's when there is the only node
without DPDK.

Change-Id: I94ee39df1d571e9f25b7083a23cef4be58303562
Related-Bug: #1566963

commit_message:
Tracking nodes operations in Nodes Table

This patch introduces nodesInProgress Set in nodesReducer instead of
dataOperationInProgress Boolean. nodesInProgress stores uuids of nodes
which have operation going on them. This advantage is used in nodes
table where a checkbox or loader spinner is used depending on whether
node is in operation or available to trigger an operation.

Change-Id: I89afa8bc3b2c55eed38b923408f4a0d98df1e713

commit_message:
libvirt: Limit live migration progress warnings

Otherwise a warning message is logged every 0.5 seconds and can quickly
fill the compute log with useless information.

Change-Id: I369bca573bf9749839873c754b2c112107876410

commit_message:
Possibility to read OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE (OS_INTERFACE) variable

Rally can create a deployment, using env variables like OS_USERNAME,
OS_PASSWORD, etc. But OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE (OS_INTERFACE) is missing for
some reason. So this patch is intended to fix the issue.

Change-Id: I60a19155d46bbdde2df0a0083512146899fdf178

commit_message:
Make keystone session stickiness optional

As part of Bug 1527717, we added in support of session stickiness for
keystone to allow for federation support in keystone. This introduced
performance issues with keystone and should not be configured by
default. This change disables the stickiness by default but allows for
it to be enabled by adding a 'federation' key to the keystone hiera
hash.

DocImpact: Keystone HAProxy session stickiness can be enabled by adding
a 'federation' key to the keystone hiera configuration. By default
session stickiness is disabled.

Change-Id: Id43446a9f923417b8fa140ffcfddb6797f1b4e48
Related-Bug: #1527717
Closes-Bug: #1582202

commit_message:
Using bootable if set for disk

If nailgun will send as bootable flag for disk we have to use this
disk and place '/boot' on it

Change-Id: I881d9fd4bb378dec78fd86aff0c314c910525110
Closes-bug: 1567450

commit_message:
Move constraints skip from venv to docs env

This was copied from ironic, where we use the 'venv' env for our 'docs'
environment. This isn't the case here, so move the install_command to
the 'docs' env where it actually has an effect.

Change-Id: I4c8ed9fe96aa5fef54dfcff4963d84a4f66609f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/89/318689/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

It can be removed when infra changes this. install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Set mariadb password at bootstrap

We did not provide MariaDB root password for bootstrap container,
which causes it fail to run. This should fix the problem.

Change-Id: I4a7037d19517b34adda86f3879ce8c39b569edac

commit_message:
Add gate-tempest-dsvm-lvm job to nova's experimental queue

This will help in testing the lvm image backend for the libvirt
driver in Nova while that code is all being refactored.

We don't need it running on all Nova changes, so this puts
it in the experimental queue so it can be run as needed.

This depends on two changes:

1. A devstack change for the LVM_VOLUME_CLEAR variable.

Depends-On: I1e97ba6ab4772a87192ae2689a25050d432358ab

2. A nova change for the lvm blacklist regex of tests.

Depends-On: I90cb85a503f95741b8e4f4f2147798d9414ce4ea

Related to blueprint libvirt-storage-pools

Change-Id: I1ddeb1cc59c590af37d7e5208d61aac0cdf81eff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/98/316298/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Deprecate API Proxies

This describes how we should deprecate API proxies to make them less
used in the wild.

APIImpact

Change-Id: Icca01fc8b2f24340a53feaf212a022e89096319a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/09/312209/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================== Deprecate API Proxies ===================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/deprecate-api-proxies Deprecate the API Proxies that exist in Nova for services that are no longer a part of Nova. Problem description =================== Many services originally existed in Nova (images, volumes, baremetal, networking) and were later spun out. At the time the ramifications for the Nova API remaining stable through this process weren't really considered. Over time all of these services have evolved, and in many cases the API that is current in these services doesn't match the semantics of the original Nova API. Maintaining a proxy layer for these services gets increasingly difficult over time, and the validity of the data returned becomes more suspect. As the Nova team we'd like to point API consumers to the native API whenever possible, and get out of the habit of being a pure proxy for other REST APIs. Use Cases --------- End users should hit the native API for images, volumes, baremetal, and networking (when using Nova Network). Proposed change =============== The API Ref site will be updated to state that all the following resources are deprecated: * /images * /os-volumes * /os-snapshots * /os-fixed-ips * /os-floating-ips * /os-floating-ip-dns * /os-floating-ip-pools * /os-floating-ips-bulk * /os-networks * /os-security-group-default-rules * /os-security-group-rules * /os-security-groups * /os-tenant-networks * /servers/{id}/os-baremetal ? (what is the path to get there otherwise) The documentation for all of these will be moved to the end of the API Ref site, and it will be visually clear this is part of the deprecated portion of the API. There will also be links to the correct corresponding parts of the documentation for the relevant APIs. Image Links ----------- All the servers resources which have an imageRef field that point back to the /images API will be updated to point to glance. (Note: Nova's only understanding of glance today is via glance.api_servers so for sites that use non accessable api_servers this could case a problem.) The current ``alternate`` links which point to the glance.api_servers will be removed. Networking API -------------- Nova Network is deprecated, as such the APIs around that networking will also be marked as deprecated, as is their use in talking to the proxy. A preamble will be written for this section to clarify the deprecation of the network API as well as the the proxy to Neutron functionality. Obviously we can't remove these APIs entirely until nova-network is removed from the tree. There is no specific timeline for that. Maintenance Status ------------------ The following rules will exist for all of these APIs. * No new features will be added to them * The code behind these APIs will be in soft freeze, bug fixing kept to a minimum. * Bugs that do not cause a 500 error are likely to be unfixed. Internal Representations Remain ------------------------------- The Nova server includes items such as: .. code:: javascript "accessIPv4": "1.2.3.4", "accessIPv6": "80fe::", "addresses": { "private": [ { "addr": "192.168.0.3", "OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr": "aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff", "OS-EXT-IPS:type": "fixed", "version": 4 } ] }, This is network information, however it's really a part of our server model. In these cases we will continue to keep this representation in our server object, even though it comes from another service. This can best be thought of as full paths in the REST API are being deprecated, resource definitions aren't changing (with the possible exception of link content changing). Administrative Control? ----------------------- We may want to consider implementing a **big red switch** for operators that would let them turn off the deprecated APIs to easily prevent their users from accessing them, to prevent future migration work on clean field environments. CONF.disable_deprecated_rest_api as a potential idea. Alternatives ------------ Keep these proxies forever. This will increase the cost of the maintenance of Nova and slow down our ability to adapt to new features and requirements. Data model impact ----------------- No immediate data model changes, however once the above APIs are actually removed from tree there is database cleanup that can be done. REST API impact --------------- This change will be done in concert with an API microversion, which will make make the following resources return a 404: * /images * /os-volumes * /os-snapshots And the following resources return a 404 if use_neutron=True: * /os-fixed-ips * /os-floating-ips * /os-floating-ip-dns * /os-floating-ip-pools * /os-floating-ips-bulk * /os-networks * /os-security-group-default-rules * /os-security-group-rules * /os-security-groups * /os-tenant-networks Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ This should reduce some load on Nova once these APIs are gone, as users will go and directly hit the APIs they need to access. Other deployer impact --------------------- None (unless we provide a switch for deployers to easily turn these off) Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: sdague Work Items ---------- * Determine if baremetal sub resource should still exist * Updated API Ref site with items as deprecated * Fix up imageRef links to go all the way to glance * Ensure there are Tempest tests for the linked resources Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= There exist many tempest tests which provide round trip on the APIs in question, but very few that actually attempt to set the resource data with the native API, then get it via the Nova API (such as IPs / Security groups that are embedded in the server representation). This should be tested more fully, and the deprecation of the proxies will be a good opportunity for that. Documentation Impact ==================== This is primarily a documentation effort, as described above. The bulk of the work will be updating the API Ref site. References ========== Newton Summit Session on API deprecations - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-nova-api History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Mitaka - Introduced

subject: Add Image.create_from_func
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-19 17:19:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3e6dd5b80d24a0ac1c17b95bced77a60ea4017ad', 'message': "Add Image.create_from_func and use it in the libvirt driver

create_from_func is a thin wrapper around import_file, which was added
incrementally in the preceding series.

Image.cache() currently has different behaviour for 'generated' disks
and disks created from a glance image. This differing behaviour varies
from backend to backend. For example, it can be seen in the Lvm
backend, which does:

  generated = 'ephemeral_size' in kwargs

i.e. it requires this context but doesn't have it. It gets it by
grepping the arguments to the create function it was passed for an
ephemeral size, and infers the type based on that. The Unbacked
backend uses image_id instead, so it's not even consistent.

The interface is to pass a create function to Image.cache(), and
separately all of the arguments which will eventually be passed to it
if we need to call it.

This new interface makes it explicit to the backend that we are
creating a generated disk by having a separate method for doing this.
We also greatly simplify the calling interface by passing in a lambda
which takes a single argument: the destination path.

Note that this change makes a significant change in behaviour for
qcow2 disks: we no longer use backing files for generated disks. There
are 2 reasons for this change, which are both bugs in the current
behaviour. Firstly, by not caching the output of mkfs, all ephemeral
filesystems will now have universally unique uuids. More
significantly, though, when block migrating an ephemeral disk we no
longer have the issue that the backing file on the destination host is
different to the backing file on the source host. The overhead of
running mkfs and mkswap for ephemeral disks is insignificant in both
time and space.

Resolves-bug: #1547577
Resolves-bug: #1547582

Change-Id: I2a8cc5f94a76d7db5f23109eccb175e66a8436d7
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-20 00:25:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/507fb7a12649d92eee11c57c3a95ef05ee90cfbb', 'message': "Add Image.create_from_func

Image.cache() currently has different behaviour for 'generated' disks
and disks created from a glance image. This differing behaviour varies
from backend to backend. For example, it can be seen in the Lvm
backend, which does:

  generated = 'ephemeral_size' in kwargs

i.e. it requires this context but doesn't have it. It gets it by
grepping the arguments to the create function it was passed for an
ephemeral size, and infers the type based on that. The Unbacked
backend uses image_id instead, so it's not even consistent.

The interface is to pass a create function to Image.cache(), and
separately all of the arguments which will eventually be passed to it
if we need to call it.

This new interface makes it explicit to the backend that we are
creating a generated disk by having a separate method for doing this.
We also greatly simplify the calling interface by passing in a lambda
which takes a single argument: the destination path.

This patch also highlights a difference in caching behaviour between
backends: the Qcow2, Rdb, and Ploop backends currently cache function
output, whereas Unbacked and Lvm don't. This should eventually be made
consistent, but this patch explicitly aims to keep the current
behaviour.

Change-Id: I2a8cc5f94a76d7db5f23109eccb175e66a8436d7

commit_message:
Add Image.create_from_func

Image.cache() currently has different behaviour for 'generated' disks
and disks created from a glance image. This differing behaviour varies
from backend to backend. For example, it can be seen in the Lvm
backend, which does:

  generated = 'ephemeral_size' in kwargs

i.e. it requires this context but doesn't have it. It gets it by
grepping the arguments to the create function it was passed for an
ephemeral size, and infers the type based on that. The NoBacking
backend uses image_id instead, so it's not even consistent.

The interface is to pass a create function to Image.cache(), and
separately all of the arguments which will eventually be passed to it
if we need to call it.

This new interface makes it explicit to the backend that we are
creating a generated disk by having a separate method for doing this.
We also greatly simplify the calling interface by passing in a lambda
which takes a single argument: the destination path.

This patch also highlights a difference in caching behaviour between
backends: the Qcow2, Rdb, and Ploop backends currently cache function
output, whereas NoBacking and Lvm don't. This should eventually be made
consistent, but this patch explicitly aims to keep the current
behaviour.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: I2a8cc5f94a76d7db5f23109eccb175e66a8436d7

subject: Implement import_file for LVM backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-09 18:21:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b0c8bc2d1d41e256fa20a88d861101eaf3281ebb', 'message': 'Implement import_file for LVM backend

This is part of a series to implement import_file for all image
backends. This is preparatory work for a subsequent change which

commit_message:
Implement import_file for LVM backend

This is used by the LVM backend in the subsequent create_from_func
patch.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: Icc74a424bb0ba2653ec2a36fb9f04d0c0243d915
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/11/278011/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.ephemeral_key_uuid = instance.ephemeral_key_uuid @contextlib.contextmanager def import_file(self, context, format, size=0): @contextlib.contextmanager def _import_direct(): # Import direct to LVM with self.remove_volume_on_error(self.path): lvm.create_volume(self.vg, self.lv, size, sparse=self.sparse) if self.ephemeral_key_uuid is not None: try: # NOTE(dgenin): Key manager corresponding to the # specific backend catches and reraises an # an exception if key retrieval fails. key = self.key_manager.get_key( context, self.ephemeral_key_uuid).get_encoded() except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to retrieve ephemeral " "encryption key")) dmcrypt.create_volume( self.path.rpartition('/')[2], self.lv_path, CONF.ephemeral_storage_encryption.cipher, CONF.ephemeral_storage_encryption.key_size, key) # NOTE: This is a wart, because the caller must know they need # to be root to write to it. It would be both cleaner and more # secure to chown this path to the nova user, and chown it back # again afterwards. yield self.path with self.lock(): # If we're importing a raw file of known size, we can import direct if size is not None and format == imgmodel.FORMAT_RAW: with _import_direct() as path: yield path # Otherwise we need to import to an intermediate temporary file and # convert the input else: with utils.tempdir() as tempdir: tempfile = os.path.join(tempdir, 'lvm_import') libvirt_utils.create_image(format, tempfile, size) yield tempfile with _import_direct() as path: images.convert_image(tempfile, path, format, self.driver_format, run_as_root=True)

commit_message:
add a tool to automate split of independent deliverable files

This tool is used to create the patches following this one in the
series.

Change-Id: I74a9750009a9c3d2385a759dced7035ff862457e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/06/317706/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
#!/usr/bin/env python # # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Move the history for independent projects into series directories. Use git as the canonical source of version numbers. """ from __future__ import print_function from __future__ import unicode_literals from distutils.version import StrictVersion import argparse import datetime import glob import os import subprocess import sys import yaml # From https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Releases RELEASES = [ ('austin', datetime.datetime(2010, 10, 21)), ('bexar', datetime.datetime(2011, 2, 3)), ('cactus', datetime.datetime(2011, 4, 15)), ('diablo', datetime.datetime(2011, 9, 22)), ('essex', datetime.datetime(2012, 4, 5)), ('folsom', datetime.datetime(2012, 9, 27)), ('grizzly', datetime.datetime(2013, 4, 4)), ('havana', datetime.datetime(2013, 10, 17)), ('icehouse', datetime.datetime(2014, 4, 17)), ('juno', datetime.datetime(2014, 10, 16)), ('kilo', datetime.datetime(2015, 4, 30)), ('liberty', datetime.datetime(2015, 10, 15)), ('mitaka', datetime.datetime(2016, 4, 7)), ('newton', datetime.datetime(2016, 10, 6)), ] def abort(code, errmsg): print(errmsg, file=sys.stderr) sys.exit(code) def date_to_release(tag_date): for release, end_date in RELEASES: if tag_date <= end_date: return release return 'UNKNOWN' KEYS_TO_COPY = [ 'release-notes', 'send-announcements-to', 'include-pypi-link', 'artifact-link-mode', ] def migrate_one(deliverable_filename, deliverable_data, repo_root, target_dir): dev_null = open('/dev/null', 'w') series_data = {} # Look at the existing data to get the repository name. This # assumes only one repo per deliverable for now. repo_name = deliverable_data['releases'][-1]['projects'][-1]['repo'] repo_dir = os.path.join(repo_root, repo_name) os.chdir(repo_dir) # Retrieve the existing tags tags_out = subprocess.check_output(['git', 'tag']) tags = [t.strip() for t in tags_out.splitlines() if t.strip()] for tag in tags: # if ('-' in tag) or ('rc' in tag) or ('a' in tag) or ('b' in tag): # print('ignoring %r' % tag) # continue try: StrictVersion(tag) except ValueError: print('ignoring %r' % tag) continue try: show_output = subprocess.check_output([ 'git', 'show', '--no-patch', '--pretty=%H %ct', tag, ], stderr=dev_null) interesting = show_output.rstrip().splitlines()[-1] print(tag + ' ' + interesting) sha, ignore, datestr = interesting.partition(' ') tag_date = datetime.datetime.utcfromtimestamp(float(datestr)) series_name = date_to_release(tag_date) except subprocess.CalledProcessError: print('did not find milestone %s tagged for %s' % (tag, repo_name)) continue the_series = series_data.setdefault(series_name, {}) the_milestone = the_series.setdefault(tag, []) the_milestone.append( (repo_name, sha) ) os.chdir(target_dir) deliverable_file_base = os.path.basename(deliverable_filename) for series, milestones in sorted(series_data.items()): d = 'deliverables/%s' % series if not os.path.exists(d): print('creating directory %s' % d) os.makedirs(d) filename = os.path.join(d, deliverable_file_base) print('creating %s' % filename) with open(filename, 'w') as f: f.write('---
') f.write('launchpad: %s
' % deliverable_file_base[:-5]) for key in KEYS_TO_COPY: if key in deliverable_data: f.write('%s: %s
' % (key, deliverable_data[key])) f.write('independent: true
') milestones_sorted = sorted(milestones.items(), key=lambda x: StrictVersion(x[0])) f.write('releases:
') for milestone, milestone_data in milestones_sorted: f.write(" - version: '%s'
" % milestone) f.write(' projects:
') for repo_short_name, sha in milestone_data: f.write(' - repo: %s
' % repo_short_name) f.write(' hash: %s
' % sha) def main(): # Argument parsing parser = argparse.ArgumentParser() parser.add_argument( 'repo_root', default=os.path.expanduser('~/repos'), help='repository parent directory', ) parser.add_argument( '--independent-dir', default=os.path.abspath('./deliverables/_independent'), help='the "_independent" directory', ) args = parser.parse_args() before = os.getcwd() # Find the independent files independent_files = glob.glob( os.path.join(args.independent_dir, '*.yaml') ) for filename in independent_files: print('processing %s' % filename) with open(filename, 'r') as f: proj_data = yaml.safe_load(f.read()) migrate_one(filename, proj_data, args.repo_root, before) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Implement import_file for ploop backend

This is used by the ploop backend in the subsequent create_from_func
patch.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: I20504f4a5c53e5c4a6384dd783cdde922380fb82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/278012/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @contextlib.contextmanager def import_file(self, context, format, size=None): with self.lock(): remove_func = functools.partial(fileutils.delete_if_exists, remove=shutil.rmtree) with fileutils.remove_path_on_error(self.path, remove=remove_func): fileutils.ensure_tree(self.path) image_path = os.path.join(self.path, "root.hds") yield image_path utils.execute('ploop', 'restore-descriptor', '-f', format, self.path, image_path) if size is not None: dd_path = os.path.join(self.path, "DiskDescriptor.xml") utils.execute('ploop', 'grow', '-s', '%dK' % (size >> 10), dd_path, run_as_root=True)

commit_message:
Implement import_file for Qcow2 backend

This is part of a series to implement import_file for all image
backends. This is preparatory work for a subsequent change which
uses import_file for all image creation.

Change-Id: I7ce2945f36299a96203fb2f3747af6fcf1f21fdb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/278010/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @contextlib.contextmanager def import_file(self, context, format, size=None): @contextlib.contextmanager def _convert(): if format == self.driver_format: yield self.path else: with utils.tempdir() as tempdir: tempfile = os.path.join(tempdir, 'qcow2_import') yield tempfile images.convert_image(tempfile, self.path, format, self.driver_format) with self.lock(): with fileutils.remove_path_on_error(self.path): with _convert() as target: libvirt_utils.create_image(format, target, size) yield target if self.preallocate and self._can_fallocate(): utils.execute('fallocate', '-n', '-l', size, self.path)

commit_message:
Allow scheduler tasks to request longer wait periods

This change allows a scheduler co-routine to yield an integer n, such
that only every nth call to TaskRunner.step() results in the co-routine
being advanced. We'll be able to use this to selectively slow down
polling of resources where and when we know it doesn't make sense to
poll every second.

Change-Id: Ifc6303524be8e477905546760279027886833617
Related-Bug: #1549219
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/48/313148/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If the task co-routine wishes to be advanced only on every nth step of the TaskRunner, it may yield an integer which is the period of the task. e.g. "yield 2" will result in the task being advanced on every second step. self._poll_period = 1 if self._poll_period > 1: self._poll_period -= 1 return False poll_period = next(self._runner) else: if isinstance(poll_period, six.integer_types): self._poll_period = max(poll_period, 1) else: self._poll_period = 1 if isinstance(subtask, types.GeneratorType): yield subtask
deleted_lines: next(self._runner) if subtask is not None: yield

commit_message:
Update tempest test vars

This commit does the following:

- removes tempest_git_repo since this is the default in the tempest
  role
- removes tempest_git_dest since this variable is no longer used in
  os_tempest
- adds tempest_venv_tag variable so tempest venv is created in
  /opt/tempest_master instead of /opt/tempest_untagged
- updates tests/test-nova-functional.yml to use {{ tempest_venv_bin }}

NOTE: We also remove the local connection from
test-prepare-containers.yml as we were seeing unexpected behaviour with
this in place (such as the host getting a container's hostname, etc.)

Change-Id: Ifa8de2c962f0bc9c1e6351eac667d4ca95a73757
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/66/315366/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tempest_git_install_branch: master tempest_requirements_git_install_branch: master

subject: Move files from mount points to actual file systems
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-18 16:53:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent/commit/d38cb7a82ce3fb2ec4762766820ed5b9b1eb21f1', 'message': "Move files from mount points to actual file systems

The thing is that sometimes we have file system images and mount
point hierachies which are not aligned. Let's say, we have root
file system image, while partition scheme says that two file
systems should be created on the node: / and /var. In this case
root image has /var directory with a set of files. Obviously, we
need to move all these files from /var directory on the root
file system to /var file system because /var directory will be
used as mount point.
In order to achieve this we mount all existent file systems into
a flat set of temporary directories. We then try to find
specific paths which correspond to mount points and move all
files from these paths to corresponding file systems.

Co-Authored-By: Alexey Stupnikov <astupnikov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I1aa7523055ac4bcf6f8a93e9740ccf652ed35cc1
Closes-Bug: #1537699

commit_message:
Move files from mount points to actual file systems

The thing is that sometimes we have file system images and mount
point hierachies which are not aligned. Let's say, we have root
file system image, while partition scheme says that two file
systems should be created on the node: / and /var. In this case
root image has /var directory with a set of files. Obviously, we
need to move all these files from /var directory on the root
file system to /var file system because /var directory will be
used as mount point.
In order to achieve this we mount all existent file systems into
a flat set of temporary directories. We then try to find
specific paths which correspond to mount points and move all
files from these paths to corresponding file systems.

Co-Authored-By: Alexey Stupnikov <astupnikov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I1aa7523055ac4bcf6f8a93e9740ccf652ed35cc1
Closes-Bug: #1537699
(cherry picked from commit 5809a3fea96b76386ddc4ccd367c21c00aa8337d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent refs/changes/37/318237/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.move_files_to_their_places() def move_files_to_their_places(self, remove_src=True): """Move files from mount points to where those files should be. :param remove_src: Remove source files after sync if True (default). """ # NOTE(kozhukalov): The thing is that sometimes we # have file system images and mount point hierachies # which are not aligned. Let's say, we have root file system # image, while partition scheme says that two file systems should # be created on the node: / and /var. # In this case root image has /var directory with a set of files. # Obviously, we need to move all these files from /var directory # on the root file system to /var file system because /var # directory will be used as mount point. # In order to achieve this we mount all existent file # systems into a flat set of temporary directories. We then # try to find specific paths which correspond to mount points # and move all files from these paths to corresponding file systems. mount_map = self.mount_target_flat() for fs_mount in sorted(mount_map): head, tail = os.path.split(fs_mount) while head != fs_mount: LOG.debug('Trying to move files for %s file system', fs_mount) if head in mount_map: LOG.debug('File system %s is mounted into %s', head, mount_map[head]) check_path = os.path.join(mount_map[head], tail) LOG.debug('Trying to check if path %s exists', check_path) if os.path.exists(check_path): LOG.debug('Path %s exists. Trying to sync all files ' 'from there to %s', mount_map[fs_mount]) src_path = check_path + '/' utils.execute('rsync', '-avH', src_path, mount_map[fs_mount]) if remove_src: shutil.rmtree(check_path) break if head == '/': break head, _tail = os.path.split(head) tail = os.path.join(_tail, tail) self.umount_target_flat(mount_map) def mount_target_flat(self): """Mount a set of file systems into a set of temporary directories :returns: Mount map dict """ LOG.debug('Mounting target file systems into a flat set ' 'of temporary directories') mount_map = {} for fs in self.driver.partition_scheme.fss: if fs.mount == 'swap': continue # It is an ugly hack to resolve python2/3 encoding issues and # should be removed after transistion to python3 try: type(fs.mount) is unicode fs_mount = fs.mount.encode('ascii', 'ignore') except NameError: fs_mount = fs.mount mount_map[fs_mount] = fu.mount_fs_temp(fs.type, str(fs.device)) LOG.debug('Flat mount map: %s', mount_map) return mount_map def umount_target_flat(self, mount_map): """Umount file systems previously mounted into temporary directories. :param mount_map: Mount map dict """ for mount_point in six.itervalues(mount_map): fu.umount_fs(mount_point) shutil.rmtree(mount_point)
deleted_lines: # FIXME(kozhukalov): When we have just os-root fs image and don't have # os-var-log fs image while / and /var/log are supposed to be # separate file systems and os-var-log is mounted into # non-empty directory on the / file system, those files in /var/log # directory become unavailable. # The thing is that among those file there is /var/log/upstart # where upstart daemon writes its logs. We have specific upstart job # which is to flush open files once all file systems are mounted. # This job needs upstart directory to be available on os-var-log # file system. # This is just a temporary fix and correct fix will be available soon # via updates. utils.execute('mkdir', '-p', chroot + '/var/log/upstart')

commit_message:
Honor $DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE in puppet-modules

Makes the puppet-modules element honor the $DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE
environment variable. This environment variable is set to source by
default.

Other elements, such as the enable-packages-install element may set it
to package.

Since the enable-packages-install element sets it to package at
01-export-install-types.bash[1], 01-puppet-modules-install-types.sh is
moved to 02-puppet-modules-install-types.sh so that it runs later.

Closes-Bug: 1583263
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/blob/master/elements/enable-packages-install/environment.d/01-export-install-types.bash

Change-Id: I1d14fc9b113d45e7ab613f44011f442e4436a904
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements refs/changes/93/318293/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DIB_INSTALLTYPE_puppet_modules=${DIB_INSTALLTYPE_puppet_modules:-"$DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE"}

commit_message:
Add a style guide

Change-Id: Id4a03408eb17c6284a7975184df25c8fa080eada
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/61/303361/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Style Guide =========== Follow `OpenStack Style Guidelines <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/>`_ and, optionally, the `Pocoo Style Guide <http://www.pocoo.org/internal/styleguide/>`_ File header ----------- Start new files with the following. Replace where needed: .. code-block:: python # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright <year> <company> # # Author: <name> <email addr> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ <package.module> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ <Describe what the module should do, especially interactions with other components and caveats> `Specs: FILL_THIS Session <https://github.com/openstack/designate-specs/blob/master/specs/FILL_THIS.rst>`_ `User documentation <FILL_THIS.html>`_ """ # noqa Example: .. code-block:: rst backend.impl_akamai ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Akamai backend. Create and delete zones on Akamai. Blah Blah... `Specs: Keystone Session <https://github.com/openstack/designate-specs/blob/master/specs/kilo/switch-to-keystone-session.rst>`_ `User documentation <backend.html>`_ When updating a module, please ensure that the related user documentation is updated as well. Docstrings ---------- Use the Sphinx markup. Here is an example: .. code-block:: python class MyClass(object): """<description> mention a function :func:`foo` or a class :class:`Bar` """ def function(self, foo): """<describe what the function does> :param foo: <description> :type foo: <type> :returns: <describe the returned value> :rtype: <returned type> :raises: <list raised exceptions> :Example: >>> a = b - c >>> <more Python code> .. note:: <add a note here> .. seealso:: <blah> .. warning:: <use sparingly> """ Logging ------- See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html .. code-block:: python # Do not use "%" string formatting # No localization for debug LOG.debug("... %s", variable) LOG.info(_LI("... %s..."), variable) # Use named interpolation when more than one replacement is done LOG.info(_LI("... %(key)s ..."), {'key': 'value', ...}) LOG.warn(_LW("... %(key)s"), {'key': 'value'}) LOG.error(_LE("... %(key)s"), {'key': 'value'}) LOG.critical(_LC("... %(key)s"), {'key': 'value'})

commit_message:
Make neutronapi get_floating*() methods return objects

This makes the neutronapi module return NeutronFloatingIP objects from
the relevant methods, instead of bare dicts.

Note that the API is returning string floating ip identifiers when neutron
is in use, as opposed to the integer ones returned when nova-network is in
use. This patch does not address that problem, but uses the new
NeutronFloatingIP.

Needed for blueprint rm-object-dict-compat-newton

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Rossiter <rlrossit@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ie60fb8661195eec9c01a57129efe8145504789e1

commit_message:
Add bootable disk node flag

Adding this flag to specified disk allows user to choose bootable disk
from Fuel UI and CLi.

This change is very important for deployments with multipath connected
block devices. Mainly, it is because, order of disks in UI can change
easly in this case, so we need introduce to user a possibility to
choose bootable disk explicitly.

Change-Id: I22ffe9104d2ec5a6598d496691fffa0087111070
Partial-Bug: #1567450

subject: Setup rsync module per object server drive
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-18 08:22:58.000000000', 'files': ['templates/object-server-replicator.conf.j2', 'templates/rsyncd.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/swift_pre_install.yml', 'templates/object-server.conf.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/swift-rsync-module-per-drive-79b05af8276e7d6e.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift/commit/507495d527db9763e2c15c87c25846ca06b9b3f0', 'message': 'Setup rsync module per object server drive

This PR sets up rsync module per drive for swift object servers. This
improves resource distribution, and also allows us to utilise rsync
module changes to prevent disk writes to specific drives when they begin
filling up.

Enable this option by setting "swift_rsync_module_per_drive: True", this
will still default to False to match upstream defaults. Additionally the
rsync max connections has been increased to match upstream defaults.

Additionally we include rsync.d/*.conf files by default and set this
directory up, so that we can add individual configuration to disable
specific drives.

Change-Id: I2019cade5bf5f2878497d30ce738dff07786fa64
(cherry picked from commit 53027de8c8e89b9611d1f61102fbe73f6eb1c100)
'}]
commit_message:
Setup rsync module per object server drive

This PR sets up rsync module per drive for swift object servers. This
improves resource distribution, and also allows us to utilise rsync
module changes to prevent disk writes to specific drives when they begin
filling up.

Enable this option by setting "swift_rsync_module_per_drive: True", this
will still default to False to match upstream defaults. Additionally the
rsync max connections has been increased to match upstream defaults.

Additionally we include rsync.d/*.conf files by default and set this
directory up, so that we can add individual configuration to disable
specific drives.

Change-Id: I2019cade5bf5f2878497d30ce738dff07786fa64
(cherry picked from commit 53027de8c8e89b9611d1f61102fbe73f6eb1c100)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/97/317897/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Enable rsync module per object server drive by setting the ``swift_rsync_module_per_drive`` setting to ``True``. Set this to configure rsync and swift to utilise individual configuration per drive. This is required when disabling rsyncs to individual disks. For example, in a disk full scenario. upgrade: - The ``swift_max_rsync_connections`` default value has changed from 2 to 4 in order to match the OpenStack swift documented value.

commit_message:
Updated role using the Multi-Distro framework

* The default apt packages have been moved into a var file
  that is only loaded when the detected OS is matched.
* The Install task file has had the apt specific tasks moved
  into a named install task file.
* The iptables checksum fix script is now conditional on the distro
* The creation of the upstart scripts is now dependent on distro version
* LBaaS scripts location can be updated based on the distro version

Implements: blueprint multi-platform-host

Change-Id: I5d19fa31ce359fc7e0d40c481e231133fd518ecb
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Fixes invalid uuid usages in functional tests

oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField will validate UUID in next major

commit_message:
Fix invalid uuid warnings

Currently, unit testcases emit FutureWarnings from oslo.versionedobjects
about invalid uuids as documented here[1].

This commit changes these tests to use valid uuids so
that when they are run these warnings are no longer emitted.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Closes-Bug: #1557378
Change-Id: I21a60e916e183f7c0fc6193d4b7caa88ae3b6d56

commit_message:
Remove marker from nova-manage cells_v2 map_instances UI

For a better user experience let's do the right thing. If no max-count
is passed in that means looping through all instances in batches, and if
max-count is used we store a marker to be used for later calls.

Because the marker is the last instance mapped there's already an entry
for that UUID in the instance_mappings table. In order to satisfy the
unique constraint on that column the marker UUID is modified by
replacing '-' with ' ' so that it can be transformed back when needed.

Change-Id: I921258d59e3054cbe874cab96cc8cc47c9a24845

commit_message:
Set functional-test directory based on var

The swift clone was hardcoded to master and should be based on the
variable we use to specify the version of swift downloaded from git.

subject: [WIP] DVR: Handle unbound allowed_address_pair port with FIP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 20:45:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5dc65c2dc82539d00069cc508ad7c07e5abadfdb', 'message': "[WIP] DVR: Handle unbound allowed_address_pair port with FIP

If an allowed_address_pair port associated with a FloatingIP
is configured to a service_port, the allowed_address_pair port
should inherit the service_ports host binding and device
owner if device_owner is not configured.

Hence the DVR will be able to deploy the FloatingIP for
the provided allowed_address_pair.

In this case if the associated port's admin state changes,
the allowed_address_pairs device_owner and host binding will
be reverted back to None.

When associated service port is deleted the allowed_address_
pairs device_owner and host binding will be reverted as well.

Change-Id: I362468f1658beea237f480ba62ca96294fb0f557
Closes-Bug: #1445255
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] DVR: Handle unbound allowed_address_pair port with FIP

If an allowed_address_pair port associated with a FloatingIP
is configured to a service_port, the allowed_address_pair port
should inherit the service_ports host binding and device
owner if device_owner is not configured.

Hence the DVR will be able to deploy the FloatingIP for
the provided allowed_address_pair.

In this case if the associated port's admin state changes,
the allowed_address_pairs device_owner and host binding will
be reverted back to None.

When associated service port is deleted the allowed_address_
pairs device_owner and host binding will be reverted as well.

Change-Id: I362468f1658beea237f480ba62ca96294fb0f557
Closes-Bug: #1445255
